item.title: OPUS: Prism Peak delayed to March 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

No longer due out this fall.

Publisher Shueisha Games and developer SIGONO have delayed multi-ending adventure game OPUS: Prism Peak from its previously planned fall 2025 release window to March 2026. It will be available for Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Here is the full message from SIGONO on the delay:

As we move into the final stages of development, we’ve taken a careful look at our schedule and decided to adjust the original release window to make sure the game reaches the level of quality we’re aiming for.

After revisiting our timeline, we can now confirm that OPUS: Prism Peak is planned for release in March 2026. Thank you so much for your continued support.

We’re truly sorry for the delay. We know this isn’t the news you were hoping for.

But we believe this extra time will help us polish the game further and bring it closer to the vision we want to deliver.

Everyone at SIGONO is giving their best, and we’re committed to bringing OPUS: Prism Peak to you in its strongest form when it arrives in March 2026.
